title: Shkodran Mustafi hits back at fan poll ranking him as the second worst defender in the world
text:
Shkodran Mustafi has dismissed a fan poll that rated him as the second worst defender in the world and says criticism of his performances by Arsenal fans has 'become irrational'.

The 2014 World Cup winner was only ranked above Manchester United's Phil Jones in a survey conducted by Spanish publication Marca.

After more than 150,000 votes were cast, Mustafi (35%) finished behind Jones (47%) in the battle to the unwanted accolade.

Shkodran Mustafi slammed claims that he is the second worst defender in the world right now

But Mustafi gave little weight to the findings, insisting that he would only have given it credibility if it was top-level coaches, rather than partisan supporters, casting the votes.

'I can also deal with harsh criticism,' the German defender told Der Speigel.

'But the criticism has escalated and become irrational. I have become a target. At some point people even blamed me for a defeat in which I hadn't played at all.'

Mustafi became the most expensive German centre back of all time when he moved to the Emirates Stadium in 2016 for €40million (£36m).

The German feels that criticism of his performances has 'become irrational' with fans online

Despite starting with promise he has more recently been vilified over his performances with Arsenal's defensive fragility showing little signs of improvement during his time at the club. Many supporters had hoped he would become the dominating centre back they had desired but he has struggled to establish a regular place since Unai Emery arrived.

Social media is highlighted as one reason behind the increasingly sharp vitriol aimed towards him but it was criticism from former Arsenal midfielder Emmanuel Petit that annoyed him most. Petit, now retired and particularly outspoken on his former club, called Mustafi the 'King of Blunders'.

In response he said: 'That annoyed me a lot. It's one thing when fans or the media criticise you. But it's something completely different when an ex-player, who knows how hard it is sometimes on the field, says something like that.

'I expect those players to be more sensitive and to see what this sharp criticism can do. In the past, it might have been in the paper for a day and then people would have forgotten. Today it's on the Internet and it's going to haunt me for the rest of my career.'
description: Shkodran Mustafi has dismissed a fan poll that rated him as the second worst defender in the world and says criticism of his performances by Arsenal fans has 'become irrational'.
